item.title: Decadal survey declares Uranus mission a priority
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One asteroid, Apophis, that will zoom close to Earth in 2029 might be the leading lady. The survey recommended that NASA try a dress rehearsal for defending us from space rocks by beefing up planetary defense. ‚ÄîMM

item.title: Elon Musk hints at tender offer for Twitter
item.description: . So even if he makes a tender offer, he won‚Äôt be able to buy the shares he offers to snatch up. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In other words, shareholders are given the option to cash out so that one individual or company can take over. Unless‚Ä¶Twitter‚Äôs board decides to crush its poison pill, which they might consider doing if the majority of shareholders chooses to accept Musk‚Äôs tender offer. ‚ÄîJW If they were to keep the poison pill in place in that scenario, they‚Äôd risk reinforcing a narrative Musk has been pushing that Twitter‚Äôs board isn‚Äôt acting in shareholders‚Äô best interests. Scott Fitzgerald‚Äôs novel Tender Is the Night and, simultaneously, his intention to make a ‚Äútender offer‚Äù for Twitter. Okay but‚Ä¶What is a tender offer?

Other Apple workers at a store in NYC said this weekend that they were collecting signatures to form a union, in the hopes of locking down a $30 minimum wage and better benefits. The iconic British tennis tournament held during the summer has banned players from both countries, which includes men‚Äôs world No. 2 Daniil Medvedev of Russia and women‚Äôs No. 4 Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus. üéâ Revolve responds to festival fail.

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But one does not simply lose more than one-third of your market value without inviting existential doubts about your business model. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. Delta Air Lines got blasted by health experts after its statement announcing the end of its mask mandate concluded that Covid-19 amounted to an ‚Äúordinary seasonal virus,‚Äù which is not the case. (Washington Post) Maybe if you‚Äôre an airline‚Ä¶don‚Äôt dip your toes into epidemiology?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Cannabis prices drop, despite inflation pressures
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. That‚Äôs according to Headset, a cannabis analytics company that tracked sales in California, Colorado, Michigan, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington‚Äîwhere prices for the same products can vary wildly. In Colorado, the price of a pound of marijuana is $799, near its lowest level on record, per the state‚Äôs Department of Revenue. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeWhile other products have taken a hit from inflation, cannabis has passed. ‚ÄîJW Why? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Zoom out: It‚Äôs not that cannabis isn‚Äôt as affected by the same pressures causing inflation as other industries. Since cannabis isn‚Äôt legal at the federal level, supply and demand at the state level has a greater influence on its price than on those of federally legal staples like gas, milk, and eggs. In fact, cannabis is relatively cheap across the board.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. FYI no, Disney World‚Äôs special district does not refer to the restaurant where they sell the massive turkey legs‚Äîit‚Äôs an administrative zone called the Reedy Creek Improvement District.

item.title: After judge drops federal transportation mask mandate, a confusing new era dawns
item.description: Then, US airlines rushed to drop their mask requirements faster than a guy in Group D lines up while first class is boarding. . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Masks had become a major frustration for airlines, which had been lobbying to end the mandate for months. Same in Philadelphia, where a new indoor mask mandate just took effect. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIt‚Äôs been more than 36 hours since a Florida judge abruptly overturned the CDC‚Äôs federal mask mandate for transportation, and Americans are still working out the implications of that‚Ä¶about-face. üôÑHere‚Äôs what you need to know:In the hours after the ruling came down, the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) said it would stop enforcing the mandate on public transportation and planes. ‚ÄîNF

item.title: Coinbase‚Äôs CEO claims no agency created its Super Bowl ad
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In a self-congratulatory Twitter thread on Sunday, Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong boasted that the crypto platform turned down an agency‚Äôs ideas for the ad before brainstorming its own, because ‚ÄúNo ad agency would have done this ad.‚Äù Coinbase‚Äôs 60-second spot‚Äîwhich featured a QR code that drove so much traffic that the app crashed‚Äîbecame the center of a squabble about which geniuses came up with the ad: Coinbase or the ad agencies it worked with. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeNearly two weeks after the Super Bowl, social media‚Äôs still buzzing about one of the ads‚Ä¶but the vibe has shifted. Sign up for Marketing Brew. ‚ÄîJWWant more marketing news? He and Rouch tweeted that the partnership was so ‚Äúseamless‚Äù that Armstrong didn‚Äôt realize.

item.title: FTC data shows ‚ÄòThe Tinder Swindler‚Äô is more common than you‚Äôd think
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. New data released by the FTC reveals that romance scams reached an all-time high in 2021, up nearly 80% from 2020. The biggest romance scam losses were paid out in crypto‚Äî$139 million in 2021. It‚Äôs a steep jump from 2017, when losses from such scams totaled $87 million. ‚ÄîMK That stat might explain why The Tinder Swindler, Netflix‚Äôs latest true-crime doc about a man accused of conning women on Tinder out of $10 million, has led the global Netflix charts since it debuted on February 2. 56,000 romance scams were reported to the FTC in 2021. According to the FTC, people have lost $1.3 billion to romance scams in the last five years‚Äî$547 million of which came (or left) in 2021. Even screentime champions in the 18‚Äì29 bracket reported 10x the amount of scams from 2017 to 2021.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Global health visionary Dr. Paul Farmer dies at 62
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Also‚Ä¶you can learn more about Farmer in the 2017 documentary Bending the Arc.‚ÄîMM Farmer, whose mission was to bring high-quality health care to low-income nations, created hospitals in Rwanda and Haiti and co-founded the global nonprofit Partners in Health. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeHarvard Medical School professor, anthropologist, and global health advocate Dr. Paul Farmer unexpectedly died in his sleep in Rwanda at 62. Tracy Kidder, the author of a book about Farmer‚Äôs inspirational work, Mountains Beyond Mountains, said Farmer ‚Äúwas the kind of person whose example can irritate you by making you feel you‚Äôve never done anything as important, and yet, in his presence, those kinds of feelings tended to vanish.‚Äù In addition to his nonprofit, Farmer brought livesaving HIV drugs to Haiti, raised millions of dollars for community health care facilities around the world, wrote 12 books, and won a number of awards, including the $1 million Berggruen Prize in 2020 for reshaping our understanding of ‚Äúwhat it means to treat health as a human right.‚Äù
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Trump‚Äôs social media app gets off to a hot, but bumpy, start
item.description: . Truth Social, led by former Republican Rep. Devin Nunes, is one of several right-learning social apps that have launched in recent years, along with Gettr, Parler, and the more established Rumble. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable.

item.title: Putin‚Äôs Fortress Russia may be no match for the ‚Äòmother of all sanctions‚Äô
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It built its own financial messaging system in case it gets blocked from the one used around the world, called SWIFT. Geopolitical experts say that the types of sanctions being prepared, which could block Russia from importing critical tech materials or cut off Russian banks from accessing the US dollar, will be enough to overcome Putin‚Äôs defenses and cause significant and immediate damage to the Russian economy. And investors are preparing for the worst: Russia‚Äôs benchmark stock index closed down 11% yesterday for its biggest single-day drop since Russia‚Äôs annexation of Crimea in 2014. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAs Russia eyes moving troops further into Ukraine, Western leaders are readying economic sanctions to punish Vladimir Putin for his aggression. US lawmakers have pledged to unleash the ‚Äúmother of all sanctions‚Äù in the event of a Russian invasion, and UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson suggested on Sunday that the sanctions will include cutting off Russian companies from using US dollars and British pounds, hitting them ‚Äúvery, very hard.‚Äù Big picture: Despite the sanction-proofing campaign, Putin‚Äôs Fortress Russia is not impenetrable. Building Fortress RussiaIf you want to sanction-proof your economy, the first place to start is padding your foreign exchange reserves, which are stockpiles of foreign currencies held by your central bank. ‚ÄîNF So sanctions hitting Russia‚Äôs energy sector could boomerang back to hurt the West and destabilize global energy markets.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Why is Norway so dang good at the Winter Olympics?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Golfer Viktor Hovland and tennis player Casper Ruud are both in the top 10 of their sports globally, while Magnus Carlsen has been ranked No. 1 in chess since 2011. Instead of locking children into high-stakes competitions as youngsters, Norway invites them to dabble in a variety of sports with only one goal: have fun. Big picture: While Norway excels at winter sports, it also punches above its weight in other athletic disciplines.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: US leaders say Putin has already decided to invade Ukraine
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Police cleared out the remaining protesters and towed the trucks that had been blockading downtown Ottawa for three weeks. üá®üá¶ The occupation of Ottawa is over. The move, brokered by French President Emmanuel Macron, is a last-ditch diplomatic effort to avert a war that US leaders say is imminent. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}Subscribeü§ùüèø Biden sends a gCal invite: President Biden has agreed ‚Äúin principle‚Äù to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin if Putin has not already invaded Ukraine.

item.title: Carl Icahn wages unusual proxy battle with McDonald's over pork sourcing
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. ‚ÄúAnimals are one of the things I feel really emotional about,‚Äù he told the WSJ. This story begins a decade ago, when, after getting an earful from Icahn and the Humane Society, McDonald‚Äôs announced that it would only buy pork from suppliers that stopped using gestation crates (tiny stalls) to hold pregnant pigs by 2022.10 years later, Icahn is arguing that the company has both a) shifted the goalposts and b) hasn‚Äôt moved fast enough. But Icahn‚Äôs approach with McDonald‚Äôs is very different. Icahn isn‚Äôt going about this in the typical wayKnown as the OG ‚Äúcorporate raider,‚Äù Icahn popularized the strategy of activist investing. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeLast Tuesday, HBO premiered a documentary on the life of Carl Icahn called Icahn: The Restless Billionaire, and just a few days later he is proving them correct. McDonald‚Äôs suppliers only move pigs out of gestation crates once they‚Äôre confirmed pregnant, which could be weeks into their 16-week pregnancies, according to Icahn. He‚Äôs not arguing that the company is undervalued because of incompetent leaders, just that it‚Äôs being unethical.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The infrastructure bill‚Äôs funding for wildlife crossings will save millions of animal lives
item.description: . A Wyoming crossing built for pronghorn migration led to a 70% reduction in wildlife‚Äìvehicle collisions. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Something that‚Äôs been proven to help: wildlife crossings‚Äîbridges, underpasses, and tunnels built specifically for animals to cross major roadways. It‚Äôs the largest investment Congress has made in such projects, and environmentalists and transportation specialists alike are relieved, because‚Ä¶It‚Äôs pretty rough out there:Every year, there are an estimated 1 to 2 million collisions between cars and large animals in the US. 13 bears were struck and killed along just a 108-mile stretch of Highway 395 in California in 2021, the most significant peak of fatalities since records began in 2002. ‚ÄîMK Why? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Arizona wildlife crossings are associated with a 90% drop in collisions in a stretch utilized by migrating elk.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Make it work: What to do when you get ghosted while applying for a job?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. ) of surveyed applicants have been left on read by a prospective employer. I was asked to go through five rounds of interviews, only to get the worst possible response: none (even after following up with their recruiter). css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. What do you do when a company ghosts you with no explanation?
item.author: Shane Loughnane

item.title: Icebreakers with‚Ä¶Hinge CEO Justin McLeod
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Obviously privacy is a huge thing for us and we have to make sure that we keep all of our users‚Äô data private. So one of those was the move to online dating. And it‚Äôs interactive, which is really effective in getting people to start a conversation. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIn light of the West Elm Caleb drama and more instances of people sharing uncensored dating app profiles on TikTok and social media, what responsibility do dating apps have to protect users' privacy? I think people also just got more thoughtful and dated with more intention. People have talked about their dating lives forever, and people will continue to talk about their dating lives. I think it‚Äôs accelerated some trends that were happening in dating already. Biggest risk I‚Äôve ever taken‚Ä¶A tie between flying to Switzerland to ask my college girlfriend to call off her wedding and move back to America with me and deciding to reboot Hinge and start over. I think my peak weirdness is my obsession with ecstatic dance. Hinge added audio prompts in October; why do you think they were so popular? [The pandemic] made a lot of people reflect on their lives and think about what really mattered to them. And as a result, people got more intentional with their relationships, which I think made Hinge an especially attractive option for people. So it's about finding that sweet spot where you're giving people enough information that they can really get a sense of who you are, but not scaring people away from doing it. The other thing is people just want to be more sure before they meet up with someone in person. He launched the first version of the dating app Hinge in 2011 but, after a rocky few years, decided to scrap it and start over in 2015.
item.author: Matty Merritt

Over 90% of US avocados came from Mexico last year, so the fruit could have experienced a serious price jump if the ban lasted longer‚Äîand its price is already at record highs. NBC Olympics host Mike Tirico also delivered pointed criticism, saying the adults in the room ‚Äúfailed to protect‚Äù Valieva during this whole ordeal.

item.title: Roku shares dive amid broader crash of pandemic darlings
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Their conviction that consumer behavior would be forever changed by Covid led them to make poor decisions that dented future prospects. One might even suggest that the companies billed as pandemic winners are not only not winners, they are also losers. 2,800 job cuts, an 82% stock plunge, and one CEO later, it decided to scrap that idea. Roku is one of many companies whose epic rise in 2020 has been overshadowed by an equally epic collapse in the last year:Shopify, which represented the Covid e-commerce boom, is down 62% from its peak.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The strange saga of Melania Trump's $170,000 NFT
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeFormer First Lady Melania Trump‚Äôs foray into NFTs has a spicy update: The wallet that created her much-discussed ‚ÄúHead of State Collection, 2022‚Äù NFT ultimately funded the account that purchased it for $170,000. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Trump‚Äôs office told Vice that the transaction was ‚Äúfacilitated on behalf of a third-party buyer,‚Äù but did not elaborate on who won the auction or why the address of the NFT creator provided the funds to the auction winner. In January, Melania Trump announced the auction of her NFT collection, which centered on a wide-brimmed hat she wore while meeting French President Emmanuel Macron. Illegal in the US since 1936, wash traders in the unregulated NFT market made about $8.9 million in profit in 2021. Investigations by Vice and Bloomberg found that the address that created Trump‚Äôs NFT funded a second address, which itself funded a third address that placed the winning bid on the items.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Battery recycling startup Redwood will take those old EV batteries off your hands
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But instead of incentivizing participation with a pizza party, Redwood is partnering with Ford and Volvo in an attempt to create a ‚Äúclosed-loop‚Äù supply chain for EV battery materials. ‚ÄîMM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! How it will work: Dealers and dismantlers in California can ask Redwood to pick up lithium-ion and nickel metal hydride batteries from EVs that have been turned out to pasture. Last year, Ford invested $50 million into Redwood to kickstart this kind of program. Redwood claims it can not only take care of battery waste safely, but also recover 95% of the materials. And Redwood, Volvo, and Ford will shoulder the costs of transportation.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Elon Musk ramps up attacks on US regulators
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It‚Äôs certainly true that Musk has ridiculed his own government to an extent we haven‚Äôt seen from a big-name CEO‚Ä¶maybe ever? The latest: Tesla yesterday accused the SEC, Wall Street‚Äôs top cop, of harassing Musk in order to ‚Äúchill‚Äù his right to free speech. ‚ÄúWorst of all,‚Äù it reads, ‚Äúthe SEC seems to be targeting Mr. Musk and Tesla for unrelenting investigation largely because Mr. Musk remains an outspoken critic of the government.‚Äù But now it‚Äôs reached a fever pitchLet‚Äôs go back to the letter Tesla sent to the SEC yesterday. In the years since, Musk and the SEC have escalated their beef, with the SEC telling Tesla that some of Musk‚Äôs tweets violated the agreement, and Musk flinging back schoolyard insults. The two sides reached an agreement that resulted in $40 million in fines, Musk having to leave his chairman position for three years, and a requirement that certain Musk tweets and other public statements get clearance from lawyers. ‚ÄîNF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Musk‚Äôs critics say these comments are not only juvenile and offensive, but also hypocritical, given the billions in government subsidies his companies have received. The complaint stems from a 2018 settlement over Musk‚Äôs tweet that he had the ‚Äúfunding secured‚Äù to take Tesla private. It‚Äôs the third federal safety probe of Tesla in six months. Musk has been a frequent critic of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. The SEC alleged that Musk broke securities law with that statement, because he wasn‚Äôt telling the truth.
